definition: Yaksu in North Korea, near the border with Liaoning and Jiling province
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
erhua variant of 藥水|药水[yao4 shui3]

sentences.english: Can run- of -mill skin contusion use gentian violet?
sentences.chinese: 一般性皮膚挫傷能不能用紫藥水？

sentences.english: It is a kind of liquid medicine , and can kill the epiphyte.
sentences.chinese: 一種液態藥水，可以殺死真菌。

sentences.english: Added wetting agents, or check the potion.
sentences.chinese: 補充溼潤劑，或檢查藥水。

sentences.english: You are my merbromin, he just a black coffee.
sentences.chinese: 妳是我的紅藥水，他只是杯黑咖啡。

sentences.english: Then you may need natural eye-drops .
sentences.chinese: 那你需要天然的眼藥水。

sentences.english: If necessary, suction off the droplets using an eyedropper or syringe.
sentences.chinese: 如有需要，用眼藥水瓶或注射器吸取液滴。

sentences.english: Now it was entering his body. In ten minutes, he would be dead.
sentences.chinese: 現在，藥水正在滲進他的身體之中，沒錯，他快死了。

sentences.english: Elan, I found this healing potion for you.
sentences.chinese: 我幫你找到了這瓶治療藥水哦。

sentences.english: Professional women have a partiality for hair-shaping lotion instead of perming.
sentences.chinese: 職業婦女偏愛免燙的美髮藥水。

sentences.english: A gas chromatographic technique tor the analisys of sodium succinate has been studied.
sentences.chinese: 用氣相色譜法測定眼藥水中琥珀酸鈉的含量。

sentences.english: I dripped a few eye drops into my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我往眼睛裏滴了幾滴眼藥水。

sentences.english: Can be pseudomyopia treated with eyedrop ?
sentences.chinese: 假性近視可以用眼藥水治嗎？

sentences.english: When talking to a good friend of mine, he recommended natural eye-drops.
sentences.chinese: 後來一個朋友推薦我用天熱眼藥水。

sentences.english: Act. 6 You are my merbromin, he just a black coffee.
sentences.chinese: 第六章“你是我的紅藥水，他只是杯黑咖啡。”

sentences.english: I just used the eyedrop that makes me look lik…
sentences.chinese: 因爲剛剛滴了眼藥水，所以你會覺得我哭了。

definition: medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
(of alcohol) to go to one's head/(old) (of a bride-to-be) to bind one's hair into a bun/(of a prostitute) to receive a patron for the first time
above/on top of/on the surface of
